noun.description: A mythological spirit of nature imagined as a beautiful maiden inhabiting rivers, woods, or other locations.
examples: the idyllic world of nymphs and shepherds

noun.description: An immature form of an insect that does not change greatly as it grows, e.g. a dragonfly, mayfly, or locust.
A mainly brown butterfly that frequents woods and forest glades.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French nimphe, from Latin nympha, from Greek numphÄ“ nymph, bride; related to Latin nubere be the wife of.
